org.opendaylight.controller.protocol_plugin.openflow.core

Interface ISwitch

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SwitchHandler

    public interface ISwitch
    This interface defines an abstraction of an Open Flow Switch.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      • asyncSend

        java.lang.Integer asyncSend(org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage msg)
        This method puts the message in an outgoing priority queue with normal priority. It will be served after high priority messages. The method should be used for non-critical messages such as statistics request, discovery packets, etc. An unique XID is generated automatically and inserted into the message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The OF message to be sent
        Returns:
        The XID used

      • asyncSend

        java.lang.Integer asyncSend(org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage msg,
                          int xid)
        This method puts the message in an outgoing priority queue with normal priority. It will be served after high priority messages. The method should be used for non-critical messages such as statistics request, discovery packets, etc. The specified XID is inserted into the message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The OF message to be Sent
        xid - The XID to be used in the message
        Returns:
        The XID used

      • asyncFastSend

        java.lang.Integer asyncFastSend(org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage msg)
        This method puts the message in an outgoing priority queue with high priority. It will be served first before normal priority messages. The method should be used for critical messages such as hello, echo reply etc. An unique XID is generated automatically and inserted into the message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The OF message to be sent
        Returns:
        The XID used

      • asyncFastSend

        java.lang.Integer asyncFastSend(org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage msg,
                              int xid)
        This method puts the message in an outgoing priority queue with high priority. It will be served first before normal priority messages. The method should be used for critical messages such as hello, echo reply etc. The specified XID is inserted into the message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The OF message to be sent
        xid - The XID to be used in the message
        Returns:
        The XID used

      • syncSend

        java.lang.Object syncSend(org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage msg)
        Sends the OF message followed by a Barrier Request with a unique XID which is automatically generated, and waits for a result from the switch.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be sent
        Returns:
        An Object which has one of the followings instances/values: Boolean with value true to indicate the message has been successfully processed and acknowledged by the switch; Boolean with value false to indicate the message has failed to be processed by the switch within a period of time or OFError to indicate that the message has been denied by the switch which responded with OFError.

      • getPhysicalPorts

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Short,org.openflow.protocol.OFPhysicalPort> getPhysicalPorts()
        Returns a map containing all OFPhysicalPorts of this switch.
        Returns:
        The Map of OFPhysicalPort

      • getPorts

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Short> getPorts()
        Returns a Set containing all port IDs of this switch.
        Returns:
        The Set of port ID

      • getPhysicalPort

        org.openflow.protocol.OFPhysicalPort getPhysicalPort(java.lang.Short portNumber)
        Returns OFPhysicalPort of the specified portNumber of this switch.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - The port ID
        Returns:
        OFPhysicalPort for the specified PortNumber

      • getPortBandwidth

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        bandwidth

      • isPortEnabled

        boolean isPortEnabled(short portNumber)
        Returns True if the port is enabled,
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the port ID
        Returns:
        True if the port is enabled

      • isPortEnabled

        boolean isPortEnabled(org.openflow.protocol.OFPhysicalPort port)
        Returns True if the port is enabled.
        Parameters:
        port - the OpenFlow port
        Returns:
        True if the port is enabled

      • getEnabledPorts

        java.util.List<org.openflow.protocol.OFPhysicalPort> getEnabledPorts()
        Returns a list containing all enabled ports of this switch.

      • getStatistics

        java.lang.Object getStatistics(org.openflow.protocol.OFStatisticsRequest req)
        Sends OFStatisticsRequest with a unique XID generated automatically and waits for a result from the switch.
        Parameters:
        req - the OF Statistic Request to be sent
        Returns:
        Object has one of the following instances/values:: List, a list of statistics records received from the switch as response from the request; OFError if the switch failed handle the request or NULL if timeout has occurred while waiting for the response.

      • isOperational

        boolean isOperational()
        Returns true if the switch has reached the operational state (has sent FEATURE_REPLY to the controller).
        Returns:
        true if the switch is operational

      • syncSendBarrierMessage

        java.lang.Object syncSendBarrierMessage()
        Send Barrier message synchronously. The caller will be blocked until the Barrier reply arrives.

      • asyncSendBarrierMessage

        java.lang.Object asyncSendBarrierMessage()
        Send Barrier message asynchronously. The caller is not blocked. The Barrier message will be sent in a transmit thread which will be blocked until the Barrier reply arrives.

      • deleteAllFlows

        void deleteAllFlows()
        Send a FLOW_MOD message with a wildcard match and action=DELETE.
